title: If Lee Sin is god tier in this jungle, its time to admit Lee Sin is a problem
body:
And not blame it on metas forcing other junglers out, poor itemization making other junglers weak and so on.

The truth is, we won't be able to determine this until competitive play starts back up. From a solo queue stand point, Lee Sin has always remained below a 50% winrate. However, keep in mind he has a ridiculously high pick rate and ban rate, which should be alarming in its own right but thats not enough to condemn a champion to death. Although its been done in the past to several other junglers.

The point is this: this is the 3rd major jungle change we've seen. This change goes above and beyond anything we've seen. This jungle is more about strategic approach, considering routes matters now. Objective control is still important but its enhanced in gameplay times a million now.

 Yes I know, Warwick is an abomination right now but Riot correctly forecasted that he would likely be a problem. After his changes and with competitive play starting up soon, we are going to see whats really strong. In my mind, all indications suggest Lee Sin is still a god tier jungler but I will want to see more than just my suspicions to prove that. And if he is, Riot, after all the major changes we've seen to the jungle the past 4 seasons, its time to admit Lee Sin is a serious problem in this game. Because history tells us when Lee Sin is good, he dicates whats good in the jungle (I.E something that can keep up with him until its brutally nerfed). And if Lee does that again, theres nothing in the world you can do to change that except address Lee Sin for real this time.

Pro players are morons when it comes to balance. They openly say they play the most OP things in the game because its the best chance of winning - nobody faults them for this, money is on the line and this is competition. But when Lee Sin is in every game and has been nerfed as much as he has been, theres a problem. 

You cant say we spam OPs to win but the suddenly say "yeah but Lee isn't OP!" How is it that a long list of junglers, who are OP at their times, get nerfed to hell and Lee is still god tier when they are until they are nerfed. Of course pros will say hes balanced, hes basically every good junglers crutch - and I dont mean that in a way to demean their skills, i say that because its true. Theres a reason every top jungler in the world mains him. Consider this, as I noted above, Lee Sin is historically the most nerfed champion in this game. And. Hes. Still. God. Tier. Think about that and let it sink in. What the actual fuck, right? Its because he has too much stuff and it allows him to dictate the jungle and its meta. If thats not OP, I don't know what is.

And further to that point, pros are paid to play, not balance. I respect their knowledge but lets not pretend they cant be wrong. How many times has doublelift said adcs will be trash tier hurrr. He even said it as recent as the BT and IE changes while ignoring the fact randuins got destroyed, ghostblade got mega buffed for carries and botrk is still overpowered as shit on anything ranged. Pros can be wrong and more importantly can be bias.

The problem isn't just that Lee Sin is too strong or whatever, he is unhealthy because when Lee Sin is strong, he not only dictates  what junglers are viable, but also what LANERS are viable. Specially in top lane, there's a lot of champions with good laning phases, strong teamfights and so on that just aren't viable because their lack of mobility means that they just get swallowed up by Lee if they attempt to be a bit dominant in lane. 

You all complain about the ranged toplane meta and what not, but Lee Sin is one of the main causes of the stale toplane meta, a ranged champion with cc that can escape a Lee, and farm far away from the minion line to be safe from fast ganks is what makes people like Lulu powerful and keeps guys like Cho'Gath completely obsolete (as far as competitive is concerned). No matter how many ranged toplaners you nerf, this game has plenty of AP casters that can go top and take their place (toplane is where midlane rejects go after all) and this will NOT change unless the exceedingly strong gank junglers get appropiate nerfs (not in their ganking power, but in giving up SOMETHING for their lane presence, more like Shaco).

Same goes for the midlane meta, extremely safe long range waveclearers like Xerath and Ziggs are a consequence of living in a world where you can get flash ganked and kicked into the middle of the lane by being a bit out of position. 

Lee Sin affects much more than just the jungle meta, and, while I'd rather not diminish his gank potential, I'd like a strong ganker like him to give up something for his insane presence, just like Shaco sacrifices his lategame.
